landing-page.title: The Home Office Forms Framework Demo
landing-page.intro: Choose one of the options below and press continue.
landing-page.p1: This is a demo application to give an idea to all audiences the capabilities of the Home Office Forms (HOF) Framework. This is used for a variety of live services which the majority are open sourced on Github.
landing-page.p2: Currently, there are options in the navigation bar above to try out and test components supported by HOF:
landing-page.li1: The 'Basic form' covers your standard HTML elements used in most forms.
landing-page.li2: The 'Complex Form' extends off this and shows more complex components, i.e. addresses.
landing-page.li3: Lastly, there is 'Build your own form'. This is just a placeholder for the moment, but we would like to create a more interactive experience for potential stakeholders so they might be able to setup a test build through the UI to see if the framework might suit their needs. For now this section redirects to our technical documentation for more in-depth information.

build-your-own-form.title: Build your own form
build-your-own-form.subheader: Access the build your own form guidance link

dob.header: What is your date of birth?

address.intro: If you have no fixed address, enter an address where we can contact you.

checkboxes.header: Where does your money come from each month?

radio.header: What country was the appeal lodged?

country.header: What country is your address located?

text-input-area.header: What are the details of your complaint?
text-input-area.intro: Briefly summarise your complaint. Include anything that can help our investigation.

checkbox-not-both-options.header: Which sections do the weapons or components fall under?
checkbox-not-both-options.important: Only in certain circumstances, such as transporting prohibited items under seal, should you select the unspecified option.

select.intro: Choose an appeal stage from the drop down menu
